for_sales.sales_text:
A very special boat, she must go to a "good home" and no sensible offer will be refused at the reduced price.

`Chough’ was designed by A R Luke of Hamble, built by Brook & Hall, Walton on the Naze in 1927. She is a gaff rigged sloop, teak on oak, lead keel, marine ply decks sheathed with epoxy. Her spars are pine and spruce, with reefing furling headsail gear, roller reefing boom, sails by Elvstrom, mainsail, two furling headsails, one Genoa and one jib. She has an asymmetric with a `Chough’ bird on it, new 2015.

She is in excellent condition, race/cruise ready. She has two anchors, chain and warp, compass, fire extinguisher, bilge pumps electric and hand operated, warps, fenders, powered by an outboard Mariner 5ph long shaft, big foot prop.

`Chough’ has a good racing record having won many Solent OGA races including Cowes Classic Class Winner 2014 and 2015. Sleeping is for two in one cabin. An inflatable dinghy is included.

boat.full_description:
‘Chough’ was designed by A R Luke of Hamble, built by Brook & Hall, Walton on the Naze in 1927.

Brenda Page confirmed that her grandfather built 'Chough' at Brook & Hall, Walton on the Naze, for a Mr Charles Pearson. A Mr Algar owned her from 1927. 'Chough' spent the 2nd World War covered up in a mud berth. Mr Charles Pearson owned her from the 1930s into the 1950s and Brenda Page has all the records that show what her grandfather did to the boat during those years.

When Charles Pearson died it is thought she was then owned by Mr Charles Pledge, then by Mr R.L.Broughton, in Lymington. Mr W.G.Stevenson owned her from 1970 to 1972 and then she was owned by Mr Brooks. Mr Cundall of Newport, Isle of Wight, owned her and was active in the Solent area.

He sold her in 1980 and subsequently she appeared on the back cover of the OGA newsletter 1989/3 with a request as to where she was. It turned out she was ashore from 1980 when Noel Peck bought her. He sold her to Sid Fisher of Brixham. Sid carried out work on the hull and deck and her new owners David and Christine Hopkins gave her a new rig and carried out more work in 2013.

‘Chough’ has a good racing record having won many Solent OGA races including Cowes Classic Class Winner 2014 and 2015.
boat.name: Chough
boat.short_description: Following major restoration, 'Chough' has varnished Burma teak planking on oak frames with copper and bronze fasteners, bronze floors, lead keel and all new bronze bolts. Her deck is epoxy sheathed.
